Classes.​Encoder

A class that packs sets of unsigned integers into a single number.

Functions
encoder.​New
function encoder.New(
bitSpace,
offset,
...
)

Creates a new bit encoder.

Parameters
number bitSpace

The amount of bits to allocate, this will prevent overflows when encoding into a data type that has limited precision or space like a float or a signed integer.

number offset

The static offset to apply to the resulting number. Enables you to use all of the space available in signed integers.

number ...

Any amount of numbers that represent the range of digits you want to encode. The resulting range will be equal to [0, n) (0 inclusive to n exclusive). Meaning that a number of 128 will support a range of 0 to 127.

Returns
Encoder

The new encoder object.

encoder.​Double
function encoder.Double(
...
)

Creates a new bit encoder pre-configured for a double. A double can store 2^52 before losing precision.

Parameters
number ...

Any amount of numbers that represent the range of digits you want to encode.

Returns
Encoder

The new encoder object.

encoder.​Float
function encoder.Float(
...
)

Creates a new bit encoder pre-configured for a float. A double can store 2^23 before losing precision.

Parameters
number ...

Any amount of numbers that represent the range of digits you want to encode.

Returns
Encoder

The new encoder object.

encoder.​UInt
function encoder.UInt(
...
)

Creates a new bit encoder pre-configured for an unsigned 32-bit integer.

Parameters
number ...

Any amount of numbers that represent the range of digits you want to encode.

Returns
Encoder

The new encoder object.

encoder.​Int
function encoder.Int(
...
)

Creates a new bit encoder pre-configured for a signed 32-bit integer.

Parameters
number ...

Any amount of numbers that represent the range of digits you want to encode.

Returns
Encoder

The new encoder object.

Members
BitSpace

Type: number

The amount of bits the encoder is configured to store.

Offset

Type: number

The offset that is applied when encoding or decoding numbers. This lets you fit larger numbers into signed integers.

Bases

Type: table

The format used by the encoder, contains all of the individual ranges.

Count

Type: number

The amount of values the encoder is configured to work with.

Methods
Encode
function CLASS:Encode(
...
)

Encodes a series of numbers into a single number.

Parameters
number ...

Any amount of numbers to encode, all of them should fit inside of the allocated space defined by the encoder object. Decimals will be truncated.

Returns
number

The resulting encoded number.

Decode
function CLASS:Decode(
num
)

Decodes a previously encoded number back into a table of numbers.

Parameters
number num

A number previously encoded with Encode.

Returns
table

A table containing all of the previously encoded numbers left-padded with 0's.
